@TonyManfredonia @bgsu ...I wasn't really able to comprehend or appreciate what was an unfamiliar style to me, and never felt satisfied with my work for it. 

I guess could have grown into it, if I was in a more ordered & less overloaded state of mind at the time.

@TonyManfredonia @bgsu ... my mental energy towards essential tasks (self-care, chores etc.) or gaining absolute confidence in my familiar stylistic territory. 

At NZ universities sonic arts is a big part of composition degrees. Because I struggled to cope with the environment & pressures...

@TonyManfredonia @bgsu "I can't yet/I can't right now/I'm still working on it" is probably a better way to put it, at least in my case.

Having autism & ADHD, and thus getting easily overwhelmed by other things (sensory stimuli or even trying to keep a schedule in track) means I choose to direct...

@TonyManfredonia @bgsu I'd say yes to tons of things, but there are two genres where I'd probably decline directly and recommend others üòÖ 

One being realistic orchestral music (üëÄ), the other being Jazz. I'd totally be up to a Metal, Techno or 8-bit OST even tho I never did sth like that really xP

@DisOmikronCJ @TonyManfredonia @bgsu Agree with the "want to" part as well! Commissions have helped me expand the variety of music that I make and coerced me to write in styles that I would've never explored by my own will.

@TonyManfredonia @bgsu Revita has music that I never knew I could and wanted to write, so big yes. However, I don't think you should blindly say yes to everything either, I still have some "I can'ts" actually üëÄüí¶
